IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR SENIOR CITIZENS
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR SENIOR CITIZENS
IRS990.Description: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES APARTMENT RENTAL HOUSING FOR SENIOR CITIZENS PURSUANT TO SECTION 236 OF THE NATIONAL HOUSING ACT. THERE ARE 168 UNITS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EX OFFICIO DIRECTOR ROBERT BOHM IS THE SON OF EX OFFICIO DIRECTOR LEE BOHM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMMUNITY HOUSING MANAGEMENT CORPORATION (CHMC) IS A RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ENTITY THAT PROVIDES MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR B'NAI B'RITH COVENANT HOUSE, INC. CHMC COLLECTS RENTS, PAYS BILLS, AND GENERALLY MAINTAINS THE HOUSING UNITS. CHMC IS ALSO THE COMMON PAYMASTER FOR ALL EMPLOYEES WHO PROVIDE THESE SERVICES TO B'NAI B'RITH AND RELATED ENTITIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EITHER THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER OR ANOTHER BOARD OFFICER REVIEWS THE 990 AND SIGNS IT ON BEHALF OF B'NAI B'RITH COVENANT HOUSE, INC. THE FULL BOARD IS PROVIDED WITH COPIES OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT REPORT AND FORM 990 FOR REVIEW AT ITS FALL MEETING IN SEPTEMBER

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD IS GIVEN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AT THEIR ANNUAL MEETING (USUALLY IN MAY) AND ALL MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO SIGN AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM. IF MEMBERS ARE NOT IN ATTENDANCE OR FORGET TO SIGN THE DOCUMENT, FOLLOW-UP EMAILS ARE SENT, AND THEY ARE ASKED TO SIGN AND FAX BACK THE DISCLOSURE FORM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AT A MEETING BETWEEN THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, USUALLY HELD IN MAY. THEY GO OVER AN ANNUAL EVALUATION AND DISCUSS FUTURE COMPENSATION. THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD THEN MEETS OR DISCUSSES THE EVALUATION AND COMPENSATION WITH THE PAST PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD AND CHAIR OR CO-CHAIR OF THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE. A LARGE CHANGE IN COMPENSATION WOULD REQUIRE A MEETING OF THE FULL PERSONNEL COMMITTEE TO APPROVE THE CHANGE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, QUESTION 19
